definition: (of an official) to travel with little luggage and just a small escort/to travel without ostentation
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
simple/uncomplicated/letter/to choose/to select/bamboo strips used for writing (old)

from/through/via/to follow/to obey/to engage in (an activity)/never (in negative sentence)/(Taiwan pr. [zong4]) retainer/assistant/auxiliary/subordinate/related by common paternal grandfather or earlier ancestor

sentences.english: Usually, he took plain carriage with fewer attendants and wore plain clothes. His behavior became polite and modest.
sentences.chinese: 平时轻车简从，穿着朴素，对人一贯保持谦恭有礼。

definition: (of a high-ranking official) to wear plain clothes in order to go about incognito
to mingle with the people incognito
to go on an inspection tour
to visit the poor and ask about their suffering (idiom)
to make an investigative visit/to go and find out from the source
to greet/to go out to meet
to have an audience (with the Emperor)
